column4: I recently installed ubuntu as 3rd OS on my pc.  I would like to mount ubuntu partitions on mandriva, but I'm having trouble typing the right stuff into /etc/fstab.  It mounts it on mandriva but once I reboot it automatically changed fstab back to original file...
you're going to have to ask in a mandriva channel for that one...
if mandriva is overwriting your fstab then it's a mandriva problem not an ubuntu problem, that it's an ubuntu partition is coincidental
there are surely remaining bugs, but the number is quite manageable now, to the point where dapper is ready for production use.
